data.title: Chicken fire rice
data.text: Good flavor.  Portions are good sized. Server was prompt.  Thought prices were a bit high on dinner menu. Lunch seems to offer better value.  Small restaurant but clean.  Street parking.

data.title: Great food, slow service
data.text:
Had a lovely dinner with my daughter, and cousin who lives nearby, but was not expecting such a wait to get our order.   Ordered an appetizer (fried wonton) and three dishes.  Took 20 minutes for just the wontons, served by someone from the kitchen (clearly, she was just helping out).  Rest of the order took another 15 minutes.  Now, it's 25 minutes of waiting for food.  It really didn't seem that busy, but maybe take-out was busy, I don't know. The staff were very kind and inviting, food was good.  
We did try the duck fried rice, but I would suggest getting your duck "fix" from another source, maybe crisp fried.  Just be prepared to wait.

data.title: Great food! Nice people!
data.text: While this place appears to be a small hole in the wall restaurant, you will be wonderfully surprised by going in. Yes, it can be a bit tight but they really do a great job with the food. We generally have gone with the seafood dishes and always found them to be well cooked and tasty.

data.title: Good Thai place in old town
data.text: It's a small place with good food. Standard Thai fare. I have been pleased with the variety of vegetarian options. Check out their happy hour too.

data.title: Love Thai? Don't say bye -- to this place! The Best!
data.text: Perfect and they deliver also. Always fresh and service is great! If you love Thai, this is your place... the menu items are vast and tantalizing delicious!

data.title: I was disappointed
data.text:
The place really needs to be redone. 

My yellow curry did not have good quality meat in it at all. I wasn't impressed with my pineapple fried rice either.

data.title: Excellent Service, Price, Food
data.text: Everything and they deliver also; the food is hot, delicious and timely delivered. One of the few perks about living at Motel 6 in Beaverton. I would recommend this place for dining to anyone, esp. if you need great cuisine delivered.

data.title: Outstanding Thai west of the Hills
data.text: Having been to Thailand twice, I'm always amazed that the US has such tasty Thai. In particular the Portland metro area has some great places. Thai Hi 5 is not Pok Pok, but for those of us who live in Beaverton and the west side, driving out to SE Portland to Pok Pok is a major expedition. After several visits, Thai Hi 5 is now our default place for take-out Thai food. Our last pickup had some standards (Green papaya salad, pad see ew, mussamen curry, mangos in sticky rice) plus Kua-Ging, a south Thailand specialty. The latter is a spicy lettuce wrap stir fry which we gobbled up instantly. We appreciate this place a lot and hope they continue.

data.title: Great thai food
data.text: My family and I really enjoy this thai restaurant.  Great food, large quantities for not a ton of $$$.  Great staff.  Only wish they were not closed between 2:30 and 4.  They miss the after school hours.

data.title: Delicious & Efficient
data.text: She had the yellow curry and I had the drunken noodle type dish. Along with salad rolls and Thai beer it was surprisingly awesome. She has lunch tomorrow and I have a great Thai spot in Beaverton! We were shocked there was no one else there and the service was terrific. The bathroom was funny and some typical clutter but if that's the only complaint, I give it a two emphatic thumbs up!

data.title: Consistently good food, prices, and they deliver!
data.text: Thai Hi 5 is our go-to Thai place in Beaverton. They are friendly, efficient, and the quality is fresh. Many times I've been sick at home and needed their hot soup and have taken advantage of their delivery services. Thank you Thai Hi 5 for continuing to serve Beaverton!

data.title: Thai Hi 5, high on my list
data.text: For Thai food in the Beaverton area this is one restaurant you need to check out. Food is very tasty and a good value. If you are dining in there is a very nice aquarium in the middle of the restaurant that helps to give it a very ralaxing atmosphere. Portions were easily enough to feed two and make great leftovers if you can't finish it all there. "Hi" on my list of Thai restaurants in the Portland area should you move there or be visiting.

data.title: Please try this place. They really deserve our support.
data.text: I just ate here today and felt obligated to write this review.  Sadly, we were the only diners there and I want this place to thrive because the food is excellent.  I have tried their stir fry and curry dishes and they have all been so full of flavor and beautifully presented.  I love the way they use fresh asparagus in many of their dishes. My wife loves their eggplant stir fry dish and my favorite is their panang salmon curry.  Beaverton is fortunate to have such a gem.  We travel from Vancouver, WA as often as we can to eat here.  Again, please try this place.  I want this restaurant to succeed so I can continue to dine here and enjoy their wonderful food.  I consider this to be a privilege.  Thank you.

data.title: Thai 5 Restaurant
data.text: This restaurant was recommended by my son and did not disappoint. The food was fresh and the portions were satisfying. Each selection is made to order and does not come from a big pot. The staff is friendly and makes sure you want to come back again. Best Thai food I've ever had!
